description: Latin debellatus, past participle of debellare (“to subdue”).

verbs.description: debellate (third-person singular simple present debellates, present participle debellating, simple past and past participle debellated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To subdue; to conquer in war.
examples: It doth notably set forth the consent of all nations and ages, in the approbation of the extirpating and debellating of giants, monsters, and foreign tyrants, not only as lawful, but as meritorious even of divine honour.
